prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.3161, 0.0] Create the first face of the sketch with the following: * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0]; End Point [0.75, 0.0] + Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0]; End Point [0.75, 0.5682] + Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5682]; End Point [0.0, 0.5682] + Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5682]; End Point [0.0, 0.0] * Loop 2: + Line 1: Start Point [0.0487, 0.0487]; End Point [0.7013, 0.0487] + Line 2: Start Point [0.7013, 0.0487]; End Point [0.7013, 0.5195] + Line 3: Start Point [0.7013, 0.5195]; End Point [0.0487, 0.5195] + Line 4: Start Point [0.0487, 0.5195]; End Point [0.0487, 0.0487] Set the scaling parameter for the sketch to 0.75, and then transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Afterwards, extrude the 2D sketch to generate a 3D model, setting the depth towards the normal vector to 0.0712, with no extrusion in the opposite direction. Part 2: Construct a second rectangular prism, joined to the first Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0487, 0.3161, 0.0487] Create the sketch for the new prism as follows: * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0]; End Point [0.6526, 0.0] + Line 2: Start Point [0.6526, 0.0]; End Point [0.6526, 0.4708] + Line 3: Start Point [0.6526, 0.4708]; End Point [0.0, 0.4708] + Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.4708]; End Point [0.0, 0.0] Set the scaling parameter for the sketch to 0.6526, and then transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the new coordinate system. Afterwards, extrude the 2D sketch to generate a 3D model, setting the depth towards the normal vector to 0.0356, with no extrusion in the opposite direction. Join this new prism to the previous one, so that the two are united as a single 3D shape. The final CAD model is a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom, and a slightly curved side. With the provided data, the height, width and length of each intermediate part and the final shape are: * Part 1: Height = 0.0712; Width = 0.7499; Length = 0.75 * Part 2: Height = 0.0356; Width = 0.6526; Length = 0.6526 * Final Shape: Height = 0.7499 + e; Width = 0.0712; Length = 0.75 + e (where e is the height of the joined parts)</description>

This will create the second part, which is an off-center rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The dimensions of this part are 0.4545 units in length, 0.3936 units in width, and 0.3936 units in height.</description>
